items.description:
I had the pleasure of co-founding this custom-made clothing startup with a friend of mine. 
 Anything technology related was my responsibility, and as we are an online-only clothing store, I had the opportunity to learn about and utilize many different aspects of web development.

This past summer I had the opportunity to intern at DoSomething.org. They run several sms games using Mobile Commons, and had an internal system that utilized different information about campaigns. Using Angular.js, I developed a tool to help campaign managers keep track of and update the info without bugging the developers.

In order to get the internship at DoSomething, I completed a small code screen. The task was to find the nearest 3 schools to a specified zip code, given a set of schools and their lat/long. I used a free geocoding service and an optimized haversine function to accomplish this task.

This is mostly in place of a lorem ipsum for now, but basically I grew increasingly bored with the default checkboxes that browsers render (which, as most any Web Developer knows, are practically impossible to style). So I decided to work on a simple method for replacing the checkboxes with more easily stylizable elements and this is the result.
